Understate: The claim may understate the fact that only seven out of the top 10 highest-income counties in the country are located around Washington D.C., implying that the concentration of wealth is even higher.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks additional supporting evidence or data to further validate the statement about the concentration of wealth around Washington D.C.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the concentration of wealth around Washington D.C. is solely due to the power of the federal government, without considering other factors such as the presence of high-paying industries or the cost of living in the area.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the concentration of wealth, such as the presence of high-paying industries or the cost of living in the area.
